chunks.zh: 碎碎念也谈相亲
chunks.en: Ramblings on Blind Dates

chunks.zh:
去年末，亲戚介绍了一个他好友的妹妹，同城老家的，加了好友没聊几句就被亲戚催着约见面。
不甚主动的我硬着头皮发出了邀约并去见了面，吃完饭在外闲逛了一下午，全程没说几句话，回来后心神俱疲。
后来隔几天聊几句有的没的。
直到春节在家，被家人亲戚各种催去人家家里见面。
chunks.en:
At the end of last year, a relative introduced me to the younger sister of a friend of his. She was from the same hometown and in the same city. After adding her as a friend, my relative urged me to arrange a meeting before we even had a proper conversation.
Not being very proactive, I bit the bullet and sent an invitation, and we met. After dinner, we wandered around outside for an afternoon, not saying much at all. I felt mentally exhausted when I got back.
After that, we chatted about random things every few days.
Until the Spring Festival, when my family and relatives kept pushing me to meet her family at their home.

chunks.zh:
最后是她和她的哥嫂一家来我这里，由我、我妹和亲戚在附近的饭店里接待。
饭桌上我表现的很局促，甚至有些紧张，不知道该怎么招呼。
饭后我和她在附近商场溜达了一下午，期间也没说太多，到六点多她主动说晚饭就不吃了，我反而松了一口气，于是两别。
chunks.en:
Eventually, she, her elder brother, his wife, and their family came to my place. My younger sister, my relative, and I received them at a nearby restaurant.
I acted very awkwardly at the dinner table, even a bit nervous. I didn't know how to properly host them.
After the meal, she and I strolled around a nearby shopping mall for an afternoon. We didn't say much during that time either. Around 6 PM, she suggested that we skip dinner, which relieved me, so we parted ways.

chunks.zh: 第二天亲戚说“等你一句话就确定关系”，我寻思试试就试试，也不知道确定了啥关系。
chunks.en: The next day, my relative said, 'We're just waiting for you to say the word to make it official.' I thought I'd give it a try, but I didn't even know what kind of relationship we were making official.

chunks.zh:
年后回到工作岗位，想着线上隔三差五聊也没啥意思，再约见面居然被拒，说什么“再说吧，上次见面话太少，见了面还没微信聊的多”，我想害挺有道理。
于是后面一段时间就开始在微信上比以往更频繁地找她，但感觉互动很少，甚至不如第二次见面前，她也很少主动问我，导致心态多少有些崩。
我比较慢热，处在于这种不尴不尬的状态中，都有点影响生活了。
chunks.en:
After returning to work after the New Year, I thought that chatting online every few days wasn't very meaningful. When I tried to arrange another meeting, I was actually rejected. She said, 'Let's talk about it later. We didn't talk much at the last meeting. We talked more on WeChat than in person.' I thought that made sense.
So, for a while after that, I started contacting her more frequently on WeChat than before. But it felt like there was very little interaction, even less than before our second meeting. She rarely asked me anything actively, which made me a bit frustrated.
I'm a slow starter, and being in this awkward situation is starting to affect my life.

chunks.zh: 我们的关系估计百分之三十左右，想说 2.14 就在眼前，到时要不要表示下。
chunks.en: I estimate our relationship is at about 30%. I was thinking that Valentine's Day is just around the corner, and I'm wondering if I should do something about it.

chunks.zh: 我他妈震惊了为啥男的都会反思相亲是不是自己问题？
chunks.en: I'm shocked, why do men always reflect on whether the blind date problem is theirs?

chunks.zh: 你去看看 xhs ，哪个女的相亲会反思是自己的问题，全部都是说相亲的男的是奇葩/抠逼的帖子
chunks.en: Go look at Xiaohongshu, which woman on a blind date would reflect on whether the problem is theirs? All the posts are saying that the men on blind dates are weirdos/stingy.

chunks.zh: 我说大哥，麻烦你自信一点 ok ？
chunks.en: I say, brother, please be more confident, okay?

chunks.zh: 我看到你这句话：《我们的关系估计百分之三十左右，想说 2.14 就在眼前，到时要不要表示下。》我就觉得你真的没救了，你和她关系不温不火的原因核心是因为，你们见面聊的不热络
chunks.en: When I saw this sentence of yours: 'I estimate our relationship is at about 30%. I was thinking that Valentine's Day is just around the corner, and I'm wondering if I should do something about it.' I felt that you're hopeless. The core reason why your relationship is lukewarm is because you didn't chat passionately when you met.

chunks.zh: 要么你下一次见面，把自己情绪提升一下，给女生带来强烈的情绪价值，然后上手，最后上床
chunks.en: Either you boost your emotions at the next meeting, bring strong emotional value to the girl, then make a move, and finally get her into bed.

chunks.zh: 要么你就直接拜拜，因为她压根没让你有心潮澎湃的感觉啊，说白了我看你的表达，就是你一点都不想干她你完全对她没性欲的感觉，那你还聊个鸡锤子，抓紧下一个吧
chunks.en: Or just say goodbye directly, because she doesn't make you feel excited at all. To put it bluntly, from your expression, I can tell that you don't want to sleep with her, you have absolutely no sexual desire for her, so why are you still chatting? Quickly move on to the next one.

chunks.zh: 别相了，很多男的相着相着就成舔狗了。
chunks.en: Don't go on blind dates. Many men become simps after going on them.

chunks.zh: 还有就是很理性但又无奈的一个问题：婆娘这种东西太无聊了，如果不是为了生理需求，很难和她们有什么共同爱好。
chunks.en: And there's also a very rational but helpless problem: women are so boring. If it weren't for physiological needs, it's hard to have any common interests with them.

chunks.zh: 比如我喜欢魔方和悠悠球，难道要和他们聊 cfop 或者 4a 的 soloham 怎么起手吗？
chunks.en: For example, I like Rubik's Cubes and yo-yos. Am I supposed to talk to them about CFOP or how to start 4A's soloham?

chunks.zh: 我不觉得有几个婆娘会感兴趣，对抗虚无的方式有很多，找婆娘是下下策。
chunks.en: I don't think many women would be interested. There are many ways to combat nothingness, and finding a woman is the worst option.

chunks.zh: 你根本不知道女人主动起来有多主动
chunks.en: You have no idea how proactive women can be when they take the initiative.

chunks.zh: 相亲的时候中间人的话不能信，更要看对方的行为，不热情回应不积极就是没兴趣。
chunks.en: You can't trust the matchmaker's words during blind dates. You need to look at the other person's behavior. Unenthusiastic and inactive responses mean they're not interested.

chunks.zh: 有时候介绍人为了尽可能成会强行让两方都继续，或者来自父母等各方的压力让对方不明确拒绝，因为明确拒绝了就要给她那边的父母和介绍人一个交代。
chunks.en: Sometimes, the matchmaker will force both parties to continue in order to make it happen as much as possible, or pressure from parents and other parties will lead the other party to not explicitly refuse, because an explicit refusal requires an explanation to her parents and the matchmaker.

chunks.zh: 而作为女生，什么都不要做就行了，懂事的你自己会知难而退，不懂事的，她有一搭没一搭敷衍你早晚你也会走，这样就可以说是你不愿意继续了。
chunks.en: As a girl, you don't need to do anything. If you're sensible, you'll back down when you see the writing on the wall. If you're not sensible, she'll just half-heartedly brush you off, and you'll leave sooner or later. That way, it can be said that you didn't want to continue.

chunks.zh: 所以作为男方，如果自己不是脸皮特别厚，或者是对对方特别满意，想要博一个小概率事件，那么感觉对方态度不够认真就应该走了。
chunks.en: So, as a man, unless you're particularly thick-skinned or extremely satisfied with the other person and want to gamble on a small probability event, you should leave if you feel that the other person's attitude is not serious enough.

chunks.zh: 跑路，下一位。
chunks.en: Run, next one.

chunks.zh: 建立亲密关系之前要当朋友，所以先把对方当朋友，你如果都不知道怎么和朋友相处，那么你先去练交朋友吧。
chunks.en: You have to be friends before building an intimate relationship, so treat the other person as a friend first. If you don't even know how to get along with friends, then go practice making friends.

chunks.zh: 交完朋友，才是从朋友升华成男女朋友，即使相亲也是这么回事，凑合着过也起码要朋友关系吧。
chunks.en: After making friends, you can rise from friends to boyfriend and girlfriend. Even blind dates are like that. If you're just settling, you should at least be friends first.

chunks.zh: 我不要做舔狗啊🤣🐶
chunks.en: I don't want to be a simp 🤣🐶

chunks.zh: 直奔婚姻的话题，看大家的未来是怎样的。
chunks.en: Go straight to the topic of marriage to see what everyone's future looks like.

chunks.zh: 好了就确定，不好就别耽误。
chunks.en: If it's good, then make it official. If it's not, don't waste time.

chunks.zh: 虽然你亲戚听起来有点离谱，但是都是积累下来的经验，相亲最优解就是这样见一面一句话确定关系，可以就定日子
chunks.en: Although your relative sounds a bit outrageous, it's all accumulated experience. The optimal solution for blind dates is to meet once and say one sentence to confirm the relationship. If it's possible, then set a date.

chunks.zh: 我的相亲流程就是，加微信后先互相介绍下自己大致情况，聊聊三观，喜欢什么类型的人，谈谈自己的消费观念，先看看合不合适，然后就直接约见面，简单喝杯茶或者咖啡，看看有没有眼缘，对对方有没有感觉，OK 的话就开始分享日常，谈论自己的喜好，去找共同点，继续约见面，拉进关系。
chunks.en: My blind date process is: after adding each other on WeChat, we first introduce our general situation, talk about our values, what kind of person we like, and talk about our consumption habits to see if we are compatible. Then we directly make an appointment to meet, simply drink tea or coffee, to see if there is any chemistry and if we have any feelings for each other. If it's OK, we start sharing our daily lives, talking about our preferences, looking for common ground, and continuing to make appointments to meet and build relationships.

chunks.zh: 感情经验为 0 就别进相亲这种 “高手” 服了
chunks.en: If your romantic experience is 0, don't enter the 'expert' arena of blind dates.

chunks.zh: 男同志们先别不乐意，大部分相亲的女孩子都不是抱着“相亲”的想法来的，本质上还是希望你主动点接近她，虽然这对相亲的男方来说挺不公平，毕竟可能努力一场她一句不合适就再见了，还是看你自己的心态，不是说就让你当舔狗，但毕竟是大老爷们，该有的包容和大方是一定要有的，看你愿意找个大大咧咧主动出击有明确目标的女孩子，还是找个被动温婉容易被你引导的女孩子，楼主的这个女孩其实已经释放了继续接触的意愿，并不反感，只是楼主前两次表现过于差了，连普通朋友的接触都算不上，试想一下如果是你同事跟你出来溜达吃饭，搞得如此尴尬的处境恐怕也不合适
chunks.en: Guys, don't be unhappy first. Most girls on blind dates don't come with the idea of 'blind date.' Essentially, they still hope you take the initiative to approach her. Although this is quite unfair to the man on the blind date, after all, she might just say it's not suitable after you put in the effort. It still depends on your own mentality. It's not saying you want you to be a simp, but after all, you're a big man, so you must have the necessary tolerance and generosity. It depends on whether you want to find a straightforward girl who takes the initiative and has clear goals, or a passive, gentle girl who is easily guided by you. The girl in the original post has actually released her willingness to continue contact and is not disgusted. It's just that the original poster's performance in the first two times was too poor, not even a normal friend's contact. Imagine if your colleague came out to stroll and eat with you, and it was such an awkward situation, it probably wouldn't be appropriate.

chunks.zh: 唉，看到程序员同胞在感情方面吃亏我是真痛心，真的不要死磕技术了，多打扮多社交培养气质，你的感情生活和职业生涯一样重要
chunks.en: Alas, seeing fellow programmers suffer in the emotional aspect is really painful for me. Don't just focus on technology. Dress up more, socialize more, and cultivate your temperament. Your love life is as important as your career.

chunks.zh: 我觉得吧，就是因为你又不住动又不拒绝的性格让人误会了。
chunks.en: I think it's because your character of neither taking the initiative nor rejecting made people misunderstand.

chunks.zh: 这个女方应该急着决定关系，你慢热也没怎么看上人家，女方的反馈可能是相处很好，你心理其实就是“再处处看”，不然两家亲戚也不可能见面。
chunks.en: The girl should be eager to decide on the relationship. You're a slow starter and didn't really fancy her. The girl's feedback may be that you get along well, but in your mind, you're actually just thinking 'let's see how it goes,' otherwise relatives from both families wouldn't have met.

chunks.zh: 后来你“热”了，对方反而不热了，原因可能是：1.
chunks.en: Later, when you 'warmed up,' the other party became less enthusiastic. The reasons may be: 1.

chunks.zh: 女方另外的相亲对象可能看对眼了。
chunks.en: The girl may have found a blind date she likes.

chunks.zh: 不想热脸帖冷屁股，对面都明显表示“等你一句话就确定关系”了，你都没有表示，这还谈个屁。
chunks.en: She doesn't want to be clingy when the other party has clearly expressed 'I'm waiting for you to say the word to make the relationship official,' and you haven't expressed it. What's the point of talking about it?

chunks.zh: 建议：1.
chunks.en: Advice: 1.

chunks.zh: 家乡的相亲都是快节奏，要么同意、要么拒绝，除非两个人都表示可以处处先。
chunks.en: Blind dates in the hometown are fast-paced. Either agree or reject unless both people express that they can try getting along first.

chunks.zh: 慢热就是闷骚，改改。
chunks.en: Being a slow starter is just being secretly horny. Change it.

chunks.zh: 撤
chunks.en: Withdraw

chunks.zh: 就是没眼缘，何必勉强自己
chunks.en: There's just no chemistry, why force yourself?

chunks.zh: 吃完饭伸手不见 5 指的小道牵手只有两人的小屋脱下内裤第二天女人主动来约开房估计是昨天没得手今天给你机会笑日久生情这种东西见几次面就定终身怎么可能不行就下一位高手都一年相 30 场女人都是奇货可居但事实在一些女性比例多的地区可是反着来要不换个地方工作
chunks.en: Holding hands on a dimly lit path after dinner, taking off your underwear in a small hut with only two people, and the next day the woman takes the initiative to ask you to open a room, probably because she didn't succeed yesterday and is giving you a chance today, haha. The idea of love growing over time, deciding on a lifelong commitment after only a few meetings, how is that possible? If it doesn't work, move on to the next one. Experts go on 30 blind dates a year Women are rare commodities, but in some areas with a high proportion of women, it's the opposite, why don't you move to another place to work?

chunks.zh: 大概卡颜了😡，换下一个。
chunks.en: Probably blocked by appearance 😡, switch to the next one.

chunks.zh: @Track13 这里也有峰哥😡
chunks.en: @Track13 There's also Brother Feng here 😡

chunks.zh: 应该把你放在供养者地位了
chunks.en: You've probably been put in the provider position.
